title: Introduction to Acupressure and Traditional Chinese Medicine

questions.question: What is the central concept in Traditional Chinese Medicine that is described as the vital life force or energy?
How many main meridians are there in the body according to TCM?
What are the pathways through which qi flows in the body called?
Which of the following best describes the holistic approach of TCM?
choices: Considering the interconnection of body, mind, and spirit
questions.answer: Considering the interconnection of body, mind, and spirit

questions.question: What is the main difference between acupuncture and acupressure?
choices: Acupuncture uses needles, while acupressure uses pressure
Acupuncture is only used for pain relief
questions.answer: Acupuncture uses needles, while acupressure uses pressure

questions.question: Which philosophical concept in TCM represents complementary opposites?
What is the term for specific locations on meridians where qi can be accessed and influenced?
During which Chinese dynasty was TCM systematized?
What is the primary goal of TCM treatments?
choices: To restore balance and harmony in the body
questions.answer: To restore balance and harmony in the body

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the Five Elements in TCM theory?
What is the name of the TCM practice that involves burning herbs near acupoints?
Which type of qi is inherited from one's parents according to TCM?
What is the term for internal organs in TCM, including both physical and energetic functions?
Which acupoint, located on the hand between the thumb and index finger, is commonly used for headache relief?
What does TCM consider to be the cause of illness?
Which of the following is NOT a traditional practice in TCM?
What is the primary function of defensive qi (Wei Qi)?
How many extraordinary meridians are there in TCM theory?
What is the TCM term for blood, which has both physical and energetic properties?
Which of the following is considered a key function of qi in the body?
What is the name of the TCM practice that involves gentle exercises and meditation?
According to TCM, what happens when qi is balanced and flowing freely?
choices: The person becomes more susceptible to pathogens

questions.question: Which organization has recognized acupuncture as a viable treatment option for various conditions?
What is the primary aim of stimulating acupoints in TCM?
choices: To restore balance to the flow of qi
questions.answer: To restore balance to the flow of qi

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the relationship between TCM and local healing traditions in Timor-Leste?
choices: TCM has replaced all local traditions
They may share similarities in their holistic approach
Local traditions are considered superior to TCM
questions.answer: They may share similarities in their holistic approach

questions.question: What is the significance of the theory of Yin and Yang in TCM?
choices: It explains the origin of the universe
It represents the balance needed for good health
It determines a person's personality type
questions.answer: It represents the balance needed for good health

questions.question: How does TCM view the relationship between physical, mental, and emotional health?
choices: They are completely separate aspects of health
Physical health is the only important factor
They are all interrelated and interconnected
questions.answer: They are all interrelated and interconnected

questions.question: What is the primary focus of acupressure treatment?
In TCM, what is believed to happen when there are blockages in qi flow?
What is the term for the most refined form of qi in TCM?
